title: Incorrect hint to import private member

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
When a private member is accessed from another module an error is raised as expected, but it is wrongly hinted that you can import it into scope, as seen in this example:

```rust
mod other_module {
    struct PrivateMember;
}

fn main() {
    PrivateMember;
}
```
```
error[E0425]: cannot find value `PrivateMember` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:6:5
  |
6 |     PrivateMember;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
help: possible candidate is found in another module, you can import it into scope
  |
1 | use other_module::PrivateMember;
  |
```
Following the hint is clearly wrong:

```
error[E0603]: struct `PrivateMember` is private
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 | use other_module::PrivateMember;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

## Meta


```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.26.0 (a77568041 2018-05-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a7756804103447ea4e68a71ccf071e7ad8f7a03e
commit-date: 2018-05-07
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.26.0
LLVM version: 6.0
```
